events.originalText: An explosion involving illegally stored mining detonators in Petlawad, India, killed 104 people and injured more than 150 others.
events.subtitle: Petlawad explosion
events.headline: 104 killed in Petlawad, India explosion

events.originalText: A Metrolink train collided head-on with a freight train in Los Angeles, California, resulting in 25 deaths and 135 injuries; the Metrolink driver had passed through a red signal, having likely been distracted by text messaging.
events.subtitle: Metrolink (California)
events.headline: 25 dead in Los Angeles train collision

events.originalText: Typhoon Maemi, the strongest recorded typhoon to strike South Korea, made landfall near Busan.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Maemi
events.headline: Typhoon Maemi hits South Korea near Busan

events.originalText: Hurricane Ismael formed off the southwest coast of Mexico; it went on to kill over a hundred people in the country.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Ismael
events.headline: Hurricane Ismael kills over 100 in Mexico

events.originalText: Aboard Space Shuttle Endeavour, American Mae Jemison became the first Black woman to travel to space.
events.subtitle: Space Shuttle Endeavour
events.headline: Mae Jemison first Black woman in space

events.originalText: The clandestine Boricua Popular Army staged a bank robbery in West Hartford, Connecticut, making off with $7 million in the largest cash theft in U.S. history at the time.
events.subtitle: Boricua Popular Army
events.headline: $7 million stolen in West Hartford bank robbery

events.originalText: South African anti-apartheid activist Steve Biko died after being beaten in police custody in Port Elizabeth.
events.subtitle: Apartheid
events.headline: Anti-apartheid activist Steve Biko dies in custody

events.originalText: In a speech at Rice Stadium in Houston, U.S. president John F. Kennedy reiterated an aspiration to land a man on the Moon before 1970.
events.subtitle: We choose to go to the Moon
events.headline: JFK aims to land man on Moon before 1970

events.originalText: Three boys in Flatwoods, West Virginia, U.S., reported seeing a ten-foot-tall (3 m) monster in the woods while investigating a UFO.
events.subtitle: Flatwoods, West Virginia
events.headline: Boys report sighting monster in West Virginia

events.originalText: The People's Liberation Army launched the Liaoshen campaign, the first of the three major military campaigns during the late stage of the Chinese Civil War.
events.subtitle: People's Liberation Army
events.headline: PLA launches Liaoshen campaign in Chinese Civil War

events.originalText: RMS Laconia was sunk by a U-boat off the coast of West Africa, which then attempted to rescue the passengers as it was acting under the old prize rules.
events.subtitle: RMS Laconia (1921)
events.headline: RMS Laconia sunk by U-boat off West Africa

events.originalText: World War II: The Imperial Japanese Army began the Battle of Edson's Ridge in an effort to retake Henderson Field on Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands from the Allies.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Imperial Japanese Army begins Battle of Edson's Ridge

events.originalText: Hungarian-American physicist Leo Szilard conceived of the idea of the nuclear chain reaction while waiting for a traffic light in Bloomsbury, London.
events.subtitle: Leo Szilard
events.headline: Leo Szilard conceives nuclear chain reaction idea in London

events.originalText: The Okeechobee hurricane first struck the island of Guadeloupe; eventually it reached the United States and caused over 4,000 deaths overall.
events.subtitle: 1928 Okeechobee hurricane
events.headline: Okeechobee hurricane causes over 4,000 deaths

events.originalText: Gustav Mahler's Symphony No. 8, one of the largest-scale choral works in the classical concert repertoire and popularly known as the "Symphony of a Thousand", was first performed in Munich (1916 performers pictured).
events.subtitle: Gustav Mahler
events.headline: Mahler's Symphony No. 8 performed in Munich

events.originalText: The English poets Robert Browning and Elizabeth Barrett Browning (pictured) eloped to Italy, marrying in secret to avoid their disapproving families.
events.subtitle: Robert Browning
events.headline: Robert and Elizabeth Barrett Browning elope to Italy

events.originalText: Reconquista: Castilian forces captured Gibraltar from the Emirate of Granada.
events.subtitle: Reconquista
events.headline: Castilian forces capture Gibraltar from Granada

events.originalText: Yax Nuun Ahiin I took the throne as the ruler (ajaw) of the Mayan city of Tikal.
events.subtitle: Yax Nuun Ahiin I
events.headline: Yax Nuun Ahiin I becomes ruler of Tikal
